full_summary:
=====================================

* **EH990-240864: Macdonald-Cartier Bridge**
    * Wearing Surface and Girder Renewal Project
    * Solicitation Reference: WS4408446657
    * Publication Date: 2024-01-30
    * Tender Closing Date: 2024-04-04
    * Expected Contract Start Date: 2024-04-01
    * Expected Contract End Date: 2026-03-31

Overview
---------

Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC) is inviting proposals from qualified structural engineering consulting firms. The selected firm will be responsible for providing full engineering services, including design, construction administration, and contract management for the Macdonald-Cartier Bridge Wearing Surface and Girder Renewal Project.

Scope of Work
-------------

The successful consultant will be required to:

* Review existing documentation
* Recommend further examination and analysis as required
* Prepare design and construction tender documents
* Provide construction and contract administration services, including resident site services
* Manage project costs, scheduling, and risk

Contract Details
----------------

* Amendment number: 6
* Solicitation number: WS4408446657
* Tender status: Expired

Key Requirements
-----------------

* The consultant must be a firm with expertise in structural engineering
* The consultant must have experience working with similar projects
* The consultant must be able to provide bilingual services (English and French)

Request for Proposal (RFP)
-------------------------

The RFP is available on the Ariba Discovery platform (https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/18656270). Interested parties must submit their proposals electronically by the closing date of April 4, 2024.

Note: The original doc included a section about trade agreements and end user entities, regions of opportunity, and regions of delivery. However, since there are no specific entities or regions mentioned in the original document, it would be better to omit these sections in the rewritten entry to maintain clarity and conciseness. Additionally, the formatting of the original document is very verbose and messy so I made significant adjustments to make it cleaner and practical without sacrificing necessary information. 

This rewritten version aims to condense the information into a more readable format, focusing on the essentials, while ensuring that important details are not excluded. Let me know if there are any further corrections or adjustments needed.
